page.title: 11Shopping - Thorpe Salvin.
page.content: There is no{shop}in the village other than the{Post Office,}for stamps and stationery, or The Parish Oven{public {house}where I can buy sweets, crisps or drinks. The Post Office will soon close down, like the sweetshop did in 1981. We can buy eggs and cheese from the{farms,}and{bread}is delivered every Wednesday and Saturday, and{milk on Tuesday,Thursday and Saturday. We also have a{grocer}delivering every Thursday. A daily newspaper is delivered every day except Sunday.The {ice cream van }comes at the weekend and I sometimes buy a 12p cornet and sometimes we have a 50p block for tea. We go by car to Tesco supermarket in{Worksop}on Friday for groceries and sometimes we go to{Sheffield}for clothes. If we only want a few small things like, torch batteries, we might go to{Kiveton. }
